article_title: David Skeel: A Puerto Rican Solution for Illinois
article_text:
When the Puerto Rico Electric Power Authority had to dip into its reserves to make a $417.6 million payment to bondholders in July, speculation grew that Prepa would miss its next big bond payment in January. With other of its public corporations in financial danger, the commonwealth itself is moving toward default.

There may be a silver lining in these financial clouds. If Puerto Rico can restructure its debt, there could be hope for...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, David Skeel writes that if a U.S. commonwealth can declare bankruptcy, it may open the way for states in debt trouble.
twitter.title: A Puerto Rican Solution for Illinois

article_summary:
If Puerto Rico can restructure its debt, there could be hope for...
With other of its public corporations in financial danger, the commonwealth itself is moving toward default.
When the Puerto Rico Electric Power Authority had to dip into its reserves to make a $417.6 million payment to bondholders in July, speculation grew that Prepa would miss its next big bond payment in January.
There may be a silver lining in these financial clouds.
